gc:State.gc:Question: Resetting the Hopper did not restore your internet connection.br;Follow the guided steps to further troubleshoot your internet connection.
Is the modem power indicator lit?
What is the power source for your modem?
Ensure the power cord is plugged into the wall outlet.br;Is the modem power indicator now lit?
Is the power cord connected to your modem?
Ensure the power cord is plugged into the modem's power port.br;Is the modem power indicator now lit?
Ensure the modem's power cord is plugged in to the power strip and the power strip is plugged into the wall outlet and powered on?br;Is the modem power indicator now lit?
Is the power cord connected to your modem?
Is the modem power indicator now lit?
Wait for the modem to restart - this may take up to 60 seconds.br;Once restarted, are the receive, send, and online indicators now flashing / lit?
Are the receive, send, and online indicators flashing / lit?
Ensure the coaxial cable is securely connected to a cable outlet.br;Are the receive, send, and online indicators now flashing / lit?
Ensure the coaxial cable is securely connected to the modem?br;Are the receive, send, and online indicators now flashing / lit?

Disconnect the power cord from the back of the modem for 10 seconds, then reconnect it. br;Wait for the modem to restart - this may take up to 60 seconds.br;Are the receive, send, and online indicators now flashing / lit?
Is the wireless indicator lit?
Ensure wireless is enabled on your modem. Is the wireless indicator now lit?
The troubleshooting steps failed to repair your connection.br;Please contact Comcast for further assistance.
The troubleshooting steps failed to repair your connection.br;Please contact Comcast for further assistance.
The troubleshooting steps failed to repair your connection.br;Please contact Comcast for further assistance.
Your modem has successfully passed the diagnostic tests.
Your modem has successfully passed the diagnostic tests.
